I participated in [Genuary](https://genuary.art/) 2026 this year. I went with one prompt a week and kept the files [here](https://github.com/WilliamTylerBradley/genuary2026). I also focused on using SVGs for this run and kept all of them 100x100.

<br>
<hr>
<center>
<h2>JAN. 1: One color, one shape</h2>
</center>
<hr>

I used an arrow that followed the gradient from OpenSimplex noise. I created a base shape, copied it on to a hexagonal grid, then used transformations to rotate them.

![Jan_01](Jan_01.svg){width=80%}

<center>
<h2>JAN. 10: Polar coordinates</h2>
</center>
<hr>

This is a random walk through polar coordinates. The arc length is consistent so the change in theta is different based on the radius.

![Jan_10](Jan_10.svg){width=80%}
